description: Wire the Scanner page UI mockup to a working backend that manages projects and executes scan-all.py scans. UI already exists at /scanner route with ProjectListCard, ConsoleTabs, and ActionBar components - need to add API routes, subprocess execution, and real-time output streaming to match the functionality of the Python Tkinter Scanner GUI.
goal: Enable users to add/remove projects, select multiple projects, click "Scan Projects" button, and see real-time scan output in the console tab - replacing the current UI-only mockup with fully functional scanner that calls scan-all.py via Node.js child_process.
requirements: Add POST/GET/DELETE endpoints at /api/scanner/projects for managing saved projects
Store projects in ~/.coderef-scanner-projects.json matching Python GUI behavior
Add POST endpoint at /api/scanner/scan to trigger batch scanning
Execute scan-all.py via Node.js child_process.spawn for each selected project
Stream real-time output using Server-Sent Events (SSE) endpoint
Update ProjectListCard to fetch and display real projects (replace mockup)
Wire 'Add Path' button to Electron IPC fs:selectDirectory dialog
Update ConsoleTabs to consume SSE stream and display real-time output
Wire ActionBar 'Scan Projects' button to trigger POST /api/scanner/scan
Track scan status (idle, scanning, complete) and update UI accordingly
Handle errors gracefully (path not found, Python missing, scan failures)
